Package com.wileyedge.fashiontrendanalysis.exceptions

Class GlobalExceptionHandler

java.lang.Object
com.wileyedge.fashiontrendanalysis.exceptions.GlobalExceptionHandler
@ControllerAdvice public class GlobalExceptionHandler extends Object
A global exception handler that intercepts exceptions thrown throughout the application and transforms them into appropriate HTTP responses. This ensures that all exceptions are caught and handled in a consistent manner, providing meaningful feedback to the client.

  • Method Details

    • handleGenericExceptions

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.Exception.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleGenericExceptions(Exception e)
      Handles general exceptions that are not caught by other specific handlers. This acts as a fallback mechanism to catch all unhandled exceptions and return a generic internal server error response.
      Parameters:
      e - the exception
      Returns:
      a response entity with status INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR

    • handleCustomUncheckedException

      @ExceptionHandler(CustomUncheckedException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleCustomUncheckedException(CustomUncheckedException e)
      Handles exceptions of type CustomUncheckedException. This is a custom exception type representing specific error scenarios within the application. This handler logs the error code associated with the exception and provides detailed feedback to the client.
      Parameters:
      e - the custom unchecked exception
      Returns:
      a response entity with status BAD_REQUEST

    • handleEmptyResultDataAccessException

      @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException.class) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleEmptyResultDataAccessException(org.springframework.dao.EmptyResultDataAccessException e)
      Handles EmptyResultDataAccessException which is thrown when a data access operation fails to return any results (e.g., querying a database for a record that doesn't exist). This handler provides a meaningful response to the client indicating that the requested data was not found.
      Parameters:
      e - the empty result data access exception
      Returns:
      a response entity with status NOT_FOUND
